【一本长空市发展简史，从公元时期一直写到了军团纪元，记述了长空市作为城市的发展和各种历史事件。】#n南方大分裂仍在继续，每天都有人流离失所，逃入长空市这个最后的庇护所。#n而李市长仍然坚持引入更多的难民。终于，长空人意识到了再城市化工程背后的阴谋。#n这三年来，长空市的城市面积翻了数倍，但城市基础设施却没有跟进，制造了大量的监管盲区和实际意义上的贫民窟。这一切并不是为了长空人的福祉，而是在利用南方军和律者之间的协议。李上校不断地扩大长空市，只是为了让长空市能够收容更多的难民。#n看着每月都在上升的犯罪率和不断延误的公交系统，感觉受到欺骗的市民们开始在线上和线下攻击李上校，联合军和同盟军双方也意识到了伯恩斯·李坚信某种理念，不会彻底倒向他们中的某一方，因此决定换下他。

【長空市の発展の歴史を簡単にまとめた本。西暦時代から軍団歴に至るまで、長空市の都市としての発展と歴史上の事件について記載している。】#n南方の大分裂は続き、毎日のように、家を失い長空市という最後の砦に身を寄せる人が増えていった。しかしリー市長は難民受け入れを拡大する姿勢をとり続ける中、長空市の人々は再都市化計画の裏にある陰謀に気づき始める事になる。3年で長空市の都市面積は数倍にも膨れ上がっていたが、都市インフラの建設が追いつかず、監督管理の死角と実質的なスラム街が大量に発生していた。取り組みは長空市の人々の福祉のためのものではなく、南方の軍部と律者との間の取り決めにかこつけて進められていたのだ。リー大佐はより多くの難民を受け入れられるようにするためだけに、長空市を際限なく拡大し続けていた。毎月のように上昇する犯罪発生率と、遅延が当たり前になった公共交通システムを見て、市民は自分たちが騙されたと考え、サイバー空間と現実世界の両方でリー大佐を批判するようになった。そして南大陸連合と三頭同盟も、バーンズ・リーがある種の理念を貫く姿勢を持っている事から、両軍のどちらかに完全になびくことはないと悟り、市長を交代させることにしたのだった。

【창공시의 발전 역사를 간략히 정리한 책. 서력 시대부터 군단력에 이르기까지, 창공시의 도시로서의 발전과 역사적 사건에 대해 기록하고 있다.】#n남방의 대분열은 계속되었고, 매일같이 집을 잃고 창공시라는 마지막 보루에 몸을 의지하는 사람들이 늘어났다. 그러나 리 시장은 난민 수용을 확대하는 자세를 취하는 가운데, 창공시의 사람들은 재도시화 계획 뒤에 숨은 음모를 눈치채기 시작한다. 3년 만에 창공시의 도시 면적은 수 배로 불어났지만, 도시 인프라 건설이 따라잡지 못해 감독 관리의 사각지대와 실질적인 슬럼가가 대량 발생하고 있었다. 이 조치는 창공시 사람들의 복지를 위한 것이 아니라, 남방의 군부와 율자 사이의 협정을 구실로 진행되고 있었던 것이다. 리 대령은 더 많은 난민을 수용하기 위해 창공시를 무분별하게 확장해 나갔다. 매달 상승하는 범죄 발생률과 지연이 일상이 된 대중교통 시스템을 보며 시민들은 자신들이 속았다고 생각했고, 사이버 공간과 현실 세계 양쪽에서 리 대령을 비난하기 시작했다. 결국 남대륙 연합과 삼두 동맹도 번즈 리가 어떤 이념을 고수하는 태도를 보이며 양군 어느 쪽에도 완전히 기울지 않을 것임을 깨닫고 시장을 교체하기로 결정했다.

有人扒出了伯恩斯·李年轻时的言论，他曾在社交媒体上发表过第一军团最著名的口号：“为全人类，献上一切”。这件事发生在内战开始之前，那时第一军团是名副其实的中央，本应非常无伤大雅。但现在他为人所恨，那就不可饶恕了。#n “伯恩斯·李是第一军团余孽”、“他放松难民管制就是为了让第一军团渗透长空市”在一片唾骂声中，伯恩斯·李宣布辞职，结束了他的市长生涯。#n在他走后，南方军的内战随即中止，使得他更像是个名副其实的瘟神。他失去了一切，联合军和同盟军都认为他“不够忠诚”，市民憎恨他偷走了自己的税金去供养外地人。他逐渐穷困潦倒，终于在43年底的一场大雨中，他死了。#n在43年的12月7日，或许是想起了自己三年前就任市长的那一天，摄入了过量酒精的李上校想前往一座自己建立的救济院，但公交司机认出了他，和市民们一起将他赶下了车。他只能徒步走向目的地，在经过一个贫民窟时，被一个抢劫的难民打倒在地，盗走了所有的财物（那个难民后来声称自己没认出李市长。）

そんな中、ある人がバーンズ・リーが若い頃、SNS上で第一軍団の最も有名なスローガン「全人類のためにすべてを捧げる」を掲載していた事実を暴露した。そもそもその書き込みは内戦が始まる前の事であり、当時の第一軍団は名実ともに中央機関としての地位にあったため、当時問題視されることはなかった。だが今や彼は人々に憎まれる立場にあったため、その書き込みは許すことのできないものと見なされた。「バーンズ・リーは第一軍団の残党」、「バーンズ・リーが難民の規制緩和を進めているのは、第一軍団を長空市に浸透させるため」などの罵声が飛ぶ中、バーンズ・リーは辞職し、彼の市長としての日々は幕を閉じた。彼が去った直後に南方軍団の内戦が停止したことも、彼が疫病神だという印象をより強いものにした。バーンズ・リーはすべてを失い、南大陸連合も三頭同盟も彼のことを忠実ではない者と見なし、市民も彼が血税を使い外部から来た人たちにいい思いをさせていると考え、彼を憎んだ。彼は次第に困窮するようになり、落ちぶれ、軍団歴43年の年の暮れ、大雨が降る中この世を去った。#n軍団歴43年12月7日、彼は3年前に市長に就任した日を思い出していたのかもしれない。その日、大量の酒を飲んだリー大佐は自分が建てた救貧院へと向かうバスに乗ったが、彼が元市長であることに気づいた運転手と市民によってバスを追い出され、仕方なく徒歩で目的地へと向かっていた。そしてスラム街を通りがかった際に、難民の強盗に遭い殴り倒され、金品をすべて盗まれてしまった。（その後の供述によると、難民は彼がリー市長だとは知らなかったそうだ。）

그런 와중에 한 사람이 번즈 리가 젊었을 때 SNS에서 제1군단의 가장 유명한 슬로건 「전 인류를 위해 모든 것을 바친다」를 게시한 사실을 폭로했다. 원래 그 게시물은 내전이 시작되기 전의 일이었고, 당시 제1군단은 명실상부한 중앙 기관으로서의 지위에 있었기에 문제시되지 않았다. 하지만 이제 그는 사람들의 미움을 받는 입장이 되어 그 게시물은 용납할 수 없는 것으로 여겨졌다.「번즈 리는 제1군단의 잔당」, 「번즈 리가 난민 규제 완화를 추진하는 것은 제1군단을 창공시에 침투시키기 위해서」 등의 비난이 쏟아지는 가운데, 번즈 리는 사임했고 그의 시장으로서의 나날은 막을 내렸다. 그가 떠난 직후 남방군단의 내전이 중단된 것도 그가 재앙의 신이라는 인상을 더욱 강하게 했다. 번즈 리는 모든 것을 잃었고, 남대륙 연합과 삼두 동맹 모두 그를 충실하지 않은 자로 여겼으며, 시민들도 그가 혈세를 써서 외부에서 온 사람들에게 혜택을 주고 있다고 생각해 그를 미워했다. 그는 점점 궁핍해져 몰락했고, 군단력 43년 연말, 폭우가 내리는 중 세상을 떠났다.#n군단력 43년 12월 7일, 그는 3년 전 시장에 취임한 날을 떠올렸을지도 모른다. 그날 많은 술을 마신 리 대령은 자신이 세운 구빈원으로 가는 버스를 탔지만, 그가 전 시장임을 알아챈 운전사와 시민들에 의해 버스에서 쫓겨났고, 어쩔 수 없이 걸어서 목적지로 향했다. 그리고 슬럼가를 지나가던 중 난민 강도들에게 맞아 쓰러진 뒤 금품을 모두 빼앗겼다. (이후 진술에 따르면 난민들은 그가 리 시장인지 몰랐다고 한다.)

Someone has picked up on remarks made by Burns Lee in his youth, when he once posted on social media the most famous slogan of the First Legion, "For all mankind, give it all." This happened before the start of the Civil War, when the First Legion was literally at the center of the country, and should have been very harmless. But now he is hated by men, and that is unforgivable. "Burns Lee is a remnant of the First Legion", "He deregulated the refugees in order to allow the First Legion to infiltrate Long Hollow" Amidst a torrent of scorn, Burns Lee announced his resignation, ending his career as mayor. The Civil War in the Confederate Army was then suspended after his departure, making him more of a veritable plague. He lost everything, the Union and Confederate armies considered him "not loyal enough," and the citizens hated him for stealing their tax money to support outsiders. He grew poorer and poorer, and finally, in late '43, he died in a downpour. On December 7, '43, perhaps remembering the day he had been inaugurated as mayor three years earlier, Colonel Lee, who had ingested an excessive amount of alcohol, tried to head to an almshouse he had built, but the bus driver recognized him and, along with the citizens, kicked him off the bus. He had to walk to his destination on foot, and while passing through a slum, he was knocked to the ground by a robbing refugee who stole all of his belongings. (The refugee later claimed that he didn't recognize Mayor Lee.)

In the midst of all this, someone revealed the fact that Barnes Lee had posted the First Corps' most famous slogan, "Give it all up for all mankind," on a social networking site when he was a young man. The postings were made before the civil war began, and at the time, the First Corps was a central institution in both name and reality, so it did not become an issue at the time. But now that he was in a position where people hated him, the post was considered unforgivable. Amid such invectives as "Burns Lee is a remnant of the First Corps," and "Burns Lee is pushing for deregulation of refugees to allow the First Corps to infiltrate Changchun City," Burns Lee resigned and his days as mayor came to an end. The fact that the civil war in the Southern Legion stopped shortly after he left also reinforced the impression that he was a plague. Burns Lee lost everything, the Confederation of the Southern Continent and the Triumvirate saw him as someone who was not loyal, and the citizens hated him because they thought he was using their blood money to make people from the outside feel good about themselves. He became increasingly impoverished and fell into decline, and died in a heavy rainstorm at the end of the year 43 A.D. of the Legion. On December 7, Legion A.D. 43, he may have been remembering the day he was sworn in as mayor three years earlier. That day, after drinking heavily, Colonel Lee boarded a bus to go to the poorhouse he had built, but was forced off the bus by the driver and citizens who realized he was a former mayor and had no choice but to walk to his destination. As he passed through a slum, he was robbed and beaten up by refugees, and all his money and goods were stolen. (According to subsequent statements, the refugees did not know he was Mayor Lee.)

苏醒过来的伯恩斯·李觉得疲惫又晕眩，雨却愈发大了，最终他失足跌进了一个排水井中，在污水中溺死了。#n如果伯恩斯·李认真招商引资，利用长空市作为传送都市这一独特的区位优势发展经济，那维修人员或许早就发现了这个被破坏的排水井，路灯也不会故障，他也就不会死了。或者说，如果他不抱着自己那第一军团式的平等理念，他想来如今也仍会是市长。毕竟即使最讨厌他的长空人也不得不承认李上校的超群学识。#n但没有如果，长空人很快便忘了他，难民们偶尔会提及“老市长”，但随着战争结束，大部分难民返回故乡，成为了新长空人的前难民需要融入当地社群，为了合群，也便不再提他。#n他们索取，他给予，伯恩斯·李的确兑现了自己年轻时的誓言，然后死了。#n而长空市在他走后进入了一个新时代，但这就是我们下一本书要讲的内容了。#n……

倒れて気を失っていたバーンズ・リーは、ひどい疲れとめまいを感じつつ目を覚ましたが、土砂降りの中、足を滑らし用水路に落ち、そのまま汚泥に塗れ溺死した。バーンズ・リーが生前、投資促進に力を入れ、転送都市という独特の強みを持つ長空市の経済を発展させていれば、崩れた水路も放置されることなく修理され、街灯も壊れることなく機能し、哀れな死に方をしなくて済んだかもしれない。それに第一軍団的な平等の理念に拘りさえしなければ、彼はまだ市長で居続けることができていたかもしれない。彼のことを毛嫌いしている長空市の人たちですら、リー大佐の学識がずば抜けていることは認めざるを得ないほどであったのだから。だが、そうしたたとえ話をした所で何も意味はない。長空市民はすぐに彼のことを忘れ去り、彼について時々語るのは難民たちくらいしかいなくなったが、彼らも戦争が終わったことでそのほとんどが長空市を去り、故郷へと帰っていった。新たに長空市市民となった難民たちも社会に融けこみ、人々に合わせるためにバーンズ・リーについて述べることはしなくなった。彼らは様々なものを求め、バーンズ・リーはそれを与えた。バーンズ・リーは若かった頃に述べたスローガンの内容を確かに実現し、この世を去ったのだった。長空市は彼が亡くなった後、新たな時代へと突入したわけだが、そこから先の内容は次巻の説明に任せることにしたい——

Awakening, Burns Lee felt tired and dizzy while the rain intensified, and he eventually lost his footing and fell into a drainage well, drowning in the sewage. If Burns Lee had been serious about attracting investment and taking advantage of Long Hollow's unique location as a teleportation metropolis to develop its economy, then the maintenance crews might have found the vandalized drainage well long ago, and the streetlights would not have malfunctioned, and he would not have died. Or rather, if he hadn't held on to his First Legion-style idea of equality, he would still be the mayor today, he thought. After all, even the most hateful of his Long Hollow Men had to recognize Colonel Lee's superior knowledge. But no, the Longhorns soon forgot about him, and the refugees occasionally mentioned the "old mayor", but as the war ended and most of the refugees returned to their homelands, the ex-refugees, who had become the new Longhorns, needed to blend in with the local community, and in the interest of fitting in, they no longer spoke of him. They took, he gave, and Burns Lee did honor his youthful vow and then died. And Long Hollow entered a new era after he was gone, but that's what we'll be talking about in the next book. ......

He was so exhausted and dizzy that he woke up, but it was pouring down and he slipped and fell into a ditch, where he drowned in the dirty water. If Burns Lee had focused on promoting investment and developing the economy of Changkuu City, which has the unique advantage of being a transfer city, the broken ditch would have been repaired instead of being left unattended, the streetlights would have worked without breaking, and he might not have had to die a miserable death.
